Html:
I created a PureMVC for TypeScript framework with a complete demo for it  : http://www.tekool.net/blog/2012/11/07/puremvc-for-typescript/

For those who don't know PureMVC, it is a lightweight framework intended to help in implementing the MVC paradigm in OO languages. It is available in many languages and now TypeScript is one of those.

It was created using the public preview TypeScript version. It includes Unit Tests made in TypeScript and run on the generated JavaScript with YUITest (included minimal YUITest descriptions file).

I had to use an Ant task of my own to recursively read TypeScript files in tests and sources directories and to fix a problem I had working on the same module from multiple TypeScript files (more explanations on my blog post).

If you are specifically interested in PureMVC, the result of my work will probably soon be published on the official PureMVC website.

As a result of this, I expect to report near 5 or 6 issues and some current issues votes. ;)

PureMVC for TypeScript framework is now officially announced on the PureMVC website : http://www.puremvc.org/

We will of course maintain it with a status of «in development» while the TypeScript language specification is no finalized.
